website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router DIR-825 is a stable performer with great features and an excellent Web interface. The outdated and bulky design, relatively short range, and merely average throughput, however, lessen its appeal.
pros: support separate wireless networks for guests

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get better range and a piddly single-band netgear WNR2020 I have in the basement works better. The router never really worked as well as it should have for the price point. And has gotten to the point after a couple of years of requiring rebooting almost every day. It either drops wireless, drops internet throughput, or both. And the front panel lights don't say anything is wrong. NO FIRMWARE UPDATES SINCE 2011.
customer_reviews.author: Sarcasmo

customer_reviews.title: I was very happy with it for about 2 years until it stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with it for about 2 years until it stopped working. I replaced it with an ASUS router (better interface, connectivity, range). I wanted to use the DIR-825 as switch and it didn't work for that either, Same think happened to my DLINK DAP1822 AP. I use to like and trust D-Link. I don't anymore. Out of 3 devices, 2 died and the other one (DLNA) got discontinued very soon after I bought it (no more updates/support).
customer_reviews.author: SRS

customer_reviews.title: Treasure Box
customer_reviews.text: Second time is a charm for this purchase. The first D-Link DIR-825 was DOA, the wall wart was dead. who would think! This second unit worked great. Both the 2.4 and 5 GHz signal could be found all over the huge conference room we were in. I was able to make adjustments on the fly to take care of the needs of over 20 users with a wide array of commercial configured computer platforms. The small compact form was a perfect replacement for our net gear router that had died after many year of the road use. We are looking for forward to many years with this treasure box router
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Extended range very good
customer_reviews.text: This device works as described. The extended range and dual bands were what we needed to connect all the devices in our home as well as our Blue-ray/Netflix players. It wasn't the easiest router that I have set up but technical assistance was excellent and walked me through my sticking point. The router does occasionally disconnect from devices as other have noted in reviews but the range is excellent and that makes up for an occasional reset. I have found that pulling the power on the router and letting it reset works more often than restarting the disconnected device. I would purchase this router again. Amazon service and delivery were excellent as usual.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mauldin

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Performance By D-Link Tech, Glenn!
customer_reviews.text: Just for the record, Glenn, a D-Link tech, is an outstanding individual. At midnight, local time, my D-Link stopped working. I had never updated firmware since buying the DIR-825 and there were five updates. Glenn, Account Number AR004227, working on Case Number C6693001, guided me through nearly 2.5 hours of downloading the firmware files onto my computer and then uploading each file to the router in sequence. Glenn's patience at that time of morning is very appreciated. He represented D-Link outstandingly.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH R LOHR

customer_reviews.title: Mac Installer Please!?!?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I suffered for the last year with an expensive Apple Time Capsule that provides pretty dismal WiFi. So far this bad boy seems to do the trick for 2 Macbooks, 1 Gateway Tablet PC, 2 Ipod Touches (on one I use Skype extensively), and a Sony PSP. So far no problems with getting a signal and download speeds are fantastic. The setup was a major pain though. The installation CD is for Windows only and advises Mac people to read a file on the disc... no help there. What could have been a 5 minute setup was turned into a multi-hour cussfest. I think it is worth the hassle though as I finally have adequate WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: Good router. Shareport is a bit sketchy.
customer_reviews.text: Router provides good strong signal. I have a wi-fi Blu-ray with streaming Netflix; the movies are near blu-ray quality and rarely rebuffer, even though the blu-ray player is on a different floor from the router, at opposite ends of my house, and must pass through 1 wall, the floor and a wood cabinet. I originally setup shareport with my printer. It worked the first time I connected to run a print job. I can't seem to get it to work since. It recognizes the printer. Shows the printer availalbe. But won't connect so I can run a print job. I'll have to contact tech to get it ironed out.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelG

customer_reviews.title: Fast and stable...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a DIR 655 which gave me nothing but problems... Even caused my cable modem to randomly reset. I returned it and got this. Big difference in reliability. If your looking for a cheap, fast, reliable, dual band router... Look no further. Mine was a Rev. B1 with firmware 2.02 NA. The only bad thing I can really say about it is... The 5 GHz band is only at 30-33% signal strength 20 feet away. But the good news is that it doesn't matter. The signal is stable and I get the maximum wireless N speed with no errors.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Raffensberger

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my D-Link DIR655 router
customer_reviews.text: My D-Link Dir-655 router was going bad (power connector). I have had it for quite awhile, so I wasn't to upset by its failing. I decided on this Dir-825 after researching it. I could tell the difference as soon as I set it up on my home system. When logging into my laptop in the Living Room it was noticeably fast with a better picture, especially when logging into my Slingbox 2000 miles away in Wisconsin. I am very pleased with my purchase and feel comfortable recommending it to others.
customer_reviews.author: AZNetCowboy

customer_reviews.title: D-Link easy to set-up and use - Update
customer_reviews.text: April 2011 - It's been over a year now with this router and it is still the best one I've ever had. I really wonder how anyone could rate this poorly. It never - and I mean never, needs to be reset (unlike LinkSys). I have the 5GHz going to my Bluray player and the 2.4GHz for iphones, etc. Both work great. Original - It's This router was the easiest to set up I've seen - just load the CD and follow directions. Enter type of protection and password - it did the rest. So far, range and speed are great. The reliability is much better than my old Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: PKR

customer_reviews.title: Great router.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Speed. From my HP notebook with 4965AGN network card, I'm seeing actual transfer rate up to 140mbps at 5GHz band, which is about 3 1/2 times the speed I was getting from my old DIR-655 router at 2.4GHz. I have about 20 wired/wireless devices connected, including 2 DAP-1522. Easy setup and intuitive web interface. CONS: Range. 5GHz range not as good as 2.4GHz. With both enabled, one computer with an USB n adapter at one end of the house cannot see or connect at 5GHz but can at 2.4GHz. Overall, I'm very happy with this upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: inlvnv

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the D-Link DIR 825 router based on the Editor's Choice from PC Magazine. My experience did not match theirs. Regularly every 20 minutes, the D-Link router would drop the internet connection. The only way to regain the connection was to reboot the PC. I tried calling D-Link about this, but after 1 hour on hold I gave up. Since I am very busy running my own business, I could not find time to install the router until 2 days after Amazon.com's return policy had expired, so of course they refused to take it back. I am stuck with it, but I will not use it.
customer_reviews.author: FarVistas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Fly for a WiFi... router that is
customer_reviews.text: I've used previous models of these D-Link routers so the interface was familiar for the most part. Set up was pretty simple, though I could tell there where a lot more settings to tweak this thing out pretty good if you want to go there. Signal defiantly penetrates the household walls better that my previous (non-dual band) models. I've had a couple Linksys and Netgear routers give up on me over the years, but every one of my D-Links are still working just as good as day one. I did recommend to a friend, and last I check, he's quite happy with his too.
customer_reviews.author: HDrider209

customer_reviews.title: Dlink DIR 825 N Router
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was right on time. No problem installing. I read a lot about wireless routers prior to my purchase and found this one to be the best and easiest to install. My husband is always trading online and he needs a reliable router, also I have Netflix all over the house and my internet used to be interrupted almost every 20 minutes . Now that I have this router,things are more reliable. I recommended it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Russo

customer_reviews.title: Great little router for DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something a little more powerful than the Linksys WRT-54GL I was using to run DD-WRT (w/VPN). A coworker recommended the DIR-825. It took a few attempts at flashing the stock firmware (using the instructions on the DD-WRT wiki), but nothing too troublesome & otherwise, painless. All-in-all, I'm very happy with the choice, performance, and speed boost this router provides me. While I can't speak for this item "out of the box", it's an excellent choice for DD-WRT users.
customer_reviews.author: RobNh00d

customer_reviews.title: DIR-825 and ROKU
customer_reviews.text: FYI...I was having a terrible time getting this router to work with ROKU using my own SSID name. I finally got it to work with WPA and the firewall enabled (ROKU told me to disable it). Here is what I did. 1) Reset your Roku using the reset button on the BOTTOM of the player...you will need a paper clip to push the tiny button. 2) Reset you router to the factory settings using the reset button. 3) Most importantly, do not change the dlink default SSID. My are "dlink" for 2.4ghz and "dlink_media" for 5ghz. 4) Go into the DIR-825 web page and get your password, then enter it into the ROKU. I hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Squires

customer_reviews.title: Smokin hot performance
customer_reviews.text: Smoking hot performance. Have it feeding my Sony DVD player via WiFI and my new Visio TV via WiFi. Handles NetFlix at the same time as my hardwired Dell desktop computer. Only issus is that FIOS does not support this unit. So if Fios goes down, I have to plug in my old Verizon D-Link before I call Fios. Once Fios is up I replace my old D-Link with this much faster DIR-825
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: ... play but when you get it right it works great. The caveat is that it is discontinued and ...
customer_reviews.text: Certainly not plug and play but when you get it right it works great. The caveat is that it is discontinued and the manufacturer will only supply free support thru 09.2015. That s the only reason I did not rate it 5 stars. Full price for a discontinued product seems a little wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Salty

customer_reviews.title: DLink 825 Router
customer_reviews.text: This router works as advertised with the exception of extended range. N-draft seems to be the same as standard G routers. There is not enough information about the USB Share Port feature. I would like to know if the USB Share port will accept other devices or are printers and hard drives the only option. For example, I have a USB driven internet, large outside antenna, that I would like to plug into the router USB port to pickup up our park provided internet service.
customer_reviews.author: Collecting Maven

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, fast connections!
customer_reviews.text: The setup of this router was very quick and easy. The options available for configuration are impressive. Without making any changes, our Xbox live connection worked great. When using other routers opening many ports is required for good operation. The great thing about this router is the ability to simultaneously create 2.4 and 5 GHz networks. Another bonus is the ability to create a guest network on each.
customer_reviews.author: MacInTX

customer_reviews.title: The signal strength is great and there is only a small difference in speed ...
customer_reviews.text: The duel bands really isn't necessary unless many devices are using heavy internet traffic at the same time and even then it is hardly noticeable. The signal strength is great and there is only a small difference in speed and ping when compared to a hard line.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: This is my second D-link.
customer_reviews.text: My first D-Link's Wi-Fi died out on it after having it about two years, so I'm hoping this one lasts longer. The "new" one I got seems to be old stock and had to have the firmware upgraded quite a bit and required a call to technical service to get it working right. I don't advise this model for a non-tech savy person.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny G

customer_reviews.title: Scammed
customer_reviews.text: I received a USED router, was out of town when it arrived and missed the return window. It doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: This router has nice features with the gigabit lan ports and dual wireless. The only thing I didn't like was the firmware. Honestly it sucks. Don't get me wrong it would work great for someone who just wants to set it and never mess with it again. i am the type that likes to know what's going on with my network and the dlink firmware just couldn't cut it. I flashed ddwrt on this router and that really changed this device. This made wireless streaming a lot smoother and consistant.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Jones

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR-825 - Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 8/2009. Have nothing but good things to say about this router - easy to set up, easy to use, and good wireless range. I'm not an expert, but I've used some of the advanced features of the router - DMZ, WPA setup, WPS (for wireless printers), application routing, firewall etc. The firmware must be updated to 2.02NA (as of 1/2010). No experience with the shareport yet, however. But we use P2P apps etc and it's been a smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: I Absolutely love this router!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a router cause my Belkin was dropping my internet connections left and right and I came across this unit for sale on Amazon, so I researched it and found out it was an amazing unit, and then I saw all the great things people were saying on the tech websites. Also the price was absolutely AMAZING!!!! This new unit has made my internet connection and LAN so stable.
customer_reviews.author: Mariner

customer_reviews.title: Dlink DIR 825 Router
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a high quality router at a decent price look no further than this router. I consider myself a techie but when it came to choosing a router I consulted a friend of mine that is in IT. After he went through some various reviews he ended up recommending the same router that he has in his office. I can honestly say I am not disappointed. We run the PS3, Netflix on another TV and my wife is on the Kindle all at the same time and there is very little noticeable lag occurring.If you are in the market for a new N router consider this Gigabit one!
customer_reviews.author: TJL

customer_reviews.title: Great router for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a school teacher and our tech guy got this router for our school. I was impressed with it there so bought it for my home use. It works just as great here- I have 4 different computers, 3 iPod/iPhones as well as an Xbox, PS3 and an Internet-connected TV that I use to watch streaming Netflix movies with. This router is able to handle all of that load very well and at a good speed for each device. Only negative is that the set-up disk is a bit quirky and those with limited router experience may find it a bit frustrating at parts, but this is a great product and well worth any small quirks here and there!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Flenniken

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price (I paid $79.99)
customer_reviews.text: The range is not super-far on the 5ghz but it has IPv6 pass through and DLNA support as well as UPnP support! I have my HD Homerun Prime broadcasting HD TV signals through my PS3, my Galaxy S3, all of my lap tops (3) and am viewing Recorded TV from my media server on my PS3 and my laptops! THe gigabit ports make the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G

customer_reviews.title: good second time around
customer_reviews.text: The router does have a stong signal. It is the center of commerical building with 18,000 sq ft surrounded by metal stud walls and even at the most remote part of the building I receive signal strenth of 80%. The first unit was dead out of the box. Amazon sent a replacement the same day I reported the problem and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: gadgettr6

customer_reviews.title: Good product to a point
customer_reviews.text: It is a good router, the OS installed is painful to use slow and unresponsive. It also loses connection intermittently now and then and loses all outbound traffic and I have been redirected to the login screen while trying to browse the internet. Buyer beware not the best out there but cheep I guess.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Good with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find the product to be amazing until I put DD-WRT on it. Once I did I was much happier with the performance out of the router. That being said the range that it covers is not quite as good as I was hoping as the signal does not reach the upstairs with more than a 4/5 bar connection (usually more like 2 or 3 bars). Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fichidius

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. It is as good as the 655 with a few more features and dual-band. The 5Ghz signal is about 40% as strong as the 2.4Ghz signal so don't expect too much if you have 5Ghz devices more than 40 feet away. Setup is easy.The router configuration is easy to get to and simple to use. Spec for spec and dollar for dollar you can't find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: DavidLynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for about a year. Since I purchased it, it has worked flawlessly. I use the router to connect wireless to streaming movies on my HD TV, wireless printer, two laptop, and Wii. For a unit that is over a year old, I find the price a little to high. Great purchase if you can find it for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E.

customer_reviews.title: As an Apple Fanboy, I always use these Dlinks
customer_reviews.text: I have Apple everything. Mac Pros, Macbook Pros, iPhones, but I never buy the Airport Extremes. They are $70-80 and offer much less than these 825s. - I've had 2 in the last year (office and home), totally reliable - setup in 3 minutes - dual networks for g devices and n devices - WPA2 security - many more clients can connect than the 50 Airport Extreme limits you too (great for restaurant owners offering free wifi) - looks great - comes with hand stand
customer_reviews.author: Keller44

customer_reviews.title: Great wired performance, not as thrilled with the wireless
customer_reviews.text: I had a DIR-625 and loved the range. The RangeBooster technology of the 625 was great. This router has some issues with range. I lose some signal strength when I go 30 feet away, and didn't have that issue with the 625. The 2.4 Ghz band seems to not have the signal strength issue as much as the 5 Ghz band does. Still, it is a great router. Can't complain about the dual 300-Mbps channels for wireless, and the GB wired ports rock. For the money, this is a good router.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Had this since May 2009
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any of the issues other customers have had with this router. It is powerful, fast, and simply gets the job done in my household. My Xbox Live connection is still strong even when I download movies at high speeds. If I had to buy this router again, I would.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dindial

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR 825 Router
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with this and had to have it repaired. The seller made things right. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Fast set up and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless router was easy to set up and works great with both my laptop and smartphone. We always use a few wireless devices at the same time, and the wireless speeds are great. USB storage drive access is a nice additional feature. The wireless range is good for my small house.
customer_reviews.author: cuzimano

customer_reviews.title: The range of the WiFi surpassed my expectation.
customer_reviews.text: My first router turns out to be a hit! We have up to 4 family members on it at once. No problemo! The ease of installation. As well as the customer service support. (24hr.s) is excellent. But what really surprised me was the range of the signal. I can be out in my garden or on the opposite side of my building. And still get a good signal. I'm looking in to getting the wireless security camera next.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Guzman

customer_reviews.title: A winner
customer_reviews.text: I just followed directions and installed it without any problems. I have my office computer (XP pro) on wire, a new (vista) laptop running 5Ghz "N" only with WPA2 and one desktop running 2.5 Ghz "G" only and WPA2. I haven't had any dropped connections since I installed it - about a month. I also updated the firmware. Update: it's now 4/21/2012 and i'm happy to report no problems whatsoever. update. it's ow 5/25/2016 and i'm still using this router with no problems at all. update: it's now 8/18/2017 and it's still running like new!
customer_reviews.author: lynchknot

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old G-router, but 5ghz band could be better
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with it. Bought initially for draft N and to use the 5ghz band (to avoid interference). Turns out the 5Ghz band had poor signal strength for my laptop (built-in N wifi). So switched to 2.4Ghz (still N) and performance was much better (consistent connections over 100mbs). My G-wifi on my other computer also improved dramatically on signal strenth and speed (consistent 54mbs), so much so that I didn't bother upgrading to an N-adapter for it. Note: I still have the occasional dropped connections, but it's much less now.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Useless (Rev. B w/ 2.02 NA Firmware)
customer_reviews.text: Intermittent WAN/Internet drops. (across LAN & WiFi) Blocked traffic on some ports out of the box. Couldn't game or watch streaming video with this router. Replaced w/ Trendnet 639GR and all is well. (but not before an ISP service call and a replaced modem) Never again D-Link.
customer_reviews.author: Saturn

customer_reviews.title: Overall, pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this model for almost a year now. I haven't had any issues with it. I like that I can run both G and N networks on it. Since setting it up, I think I've had to reset it twice. I installed the same unit at a friend's place of business 6 months before I purchased my own. I've never received a call asking for help with their Internet/WIFI connection. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Vendors on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've used this router for years to pass VOIP alongside normal internet for small offices. The added QOS allows me to weight the VOIP traffic above the usual http gets and keeps small offices happy. This is my go to router when I don't need a Cisco solution for a five person office that needs reliability at a low price. My usual vendor was out of stock so I tried Amazon. The shipper was excellent; I had a replacement router the next day by 2:00pm.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Michaud

customer_reviews.title: Most reliable router I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a D-Link guy and have had pretty good luck with their routers in the past, a couple that needed to be reset every-so-often. However, this one after buying for the gigabit LAN and dual-band N, has been the most rock-solid piece of hardware I've ever owned. It has very fast transfer speeds and does exactly what I want it to. I had reservations spending the extra $ on the gigabit feature, but after having it for a couple of months already, it is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fears

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR-825 Extreme-N Dual-Band Gigabit Router
customer_reviews.text: This Router was the first one I have ever setup and they made it so easy. Did not take very long to setup. I have an excellent connection from one end of the house to the other. I sat on the front porch and still had a good Connection.
customer_reviews.author: Edw

customer_reviews.title: Dir-825 OK - Setup Not
customer_reviews.text: I had some setup problems as I entered my static IP address incorrectly via their wizard and the setup software just terminated with a non-useful error message. When I setup the modem in manual mode .. it went pretty smooth and all seem to work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bobgott

customer_reviews.title: Great for LAN games
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this router so that I could play LAN games with and so far it has worked well. The connection is fast and playing 6 players on Starwars Battlefront 2, it only lakes once or twice for a second for two of the guy in the time span of an hour and a half. It is doing great for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I expect a product to work for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This product died after 2 years and two months. It was great while it lasted. It now continually drops. It took me a while to narrow it down to the wifi too. I will give it a star for each year.
customer_reviews.author: J. Abram Barneck

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Turns out I didn't need it, because Comcast would have put one in with less brain work from me. I don't know how it compares to other routers, but I had a bit of trouble from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: WON'T WORK WITH IPHONE, IPAD 2
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this router based on reviews but after hours of effort found that it won't link to the Ipad 2. Also found it won't work with my iPhone 3G in any secure (WPA-personal, etc.) mode. There wasn't any mention of this on the D-Link website and no firmware updates are available. A call to tech support got the reply that there was nothing they could do and I should call Apple. Instead, I boxed it up and sent it back. On the plus side, the router was easy and quick to set up with my DSL modem, and worked out of the box with my Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Jablon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, works great, not any problem with that, works fine with all my apple products, works better than my old cisco router
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: D-link 802.11n Router
customer_reviews.text: The D-link 802.11n router sports all the necessary features in a modern router, but I found it a little difficult to set up. The instructions assume the existence of a router, but mine had failed, so this was a new setup. I had to finesse the procedure, but it worked. A more naive user may have been more frustrated. Other than that, it works well. I see the various networks around the neighborhood. Adding hosts (I have 5) is easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this router. We have a pretty big family that is constantly coming and going everyone is connected to the wifi in some way and we have never had a problem with this router.
customer_reviews.author: irishar

customer_reviews.title: It was working really well during the time i had ...
customer_reviews.text: It was working really well during the time i had it. After about 4-6 months, it started to drop connections from some wireless devices, since then i had to get a new Router
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Dir-825 Router
customer_reviews.text: The D-Link 825 Router actually works well with the original firmware which is confusing to me.One would think an updated version of firmware would enhance the speed performance of the router.Other than this problem with the Router it is a dependable one less the speed.I purchased this Router because of the ipv6 compatibility which is not easy to configure.I am going back to my work horse Router the DIR 615 because I get the signal and 300 Mbps speeds throughout my network.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo84

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fast, simple setup for first computer, slight complication with second. Support was accessible and extremely helpful. I have my pictures and videos on a 1T hard drive that is accessible to both computers through shareport - which I love. Both computers are so much faster without losing access to the thousands of pictures of our three beautiful children.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Brief Overview of D-Link DIR-825
customer_reviews.text: This is just a brief overview of the D-Link DIR-825. It arrived about 48 hrs ago. I had no setup problems what so ever using the setup CD. QoS system works great and greatly improved my Netflix experience on my Xbox 360.I will repost again in a month or so to update. ***Many months later without a single power reboot, router working fine at top speed of my ISP (10 Mbps). I've never owned a more reliable router besides my old Linksys WRT54G. Since then I've added a Linksys Wirelss N Dual bridge and a switch at my home entertainment center and has an attached 360, PS3 and Sony Blu Ray player.
customer_reviews.author: AZURE.B

customer_reviews.title: Great and fast
customer_reviews.text: I had two Netgear draft-N routers before this. The first stopped working at 2 years old; the second stopped seeing network items 1 year, 7 months old. I decided I needed a new manufacturer's router, and bought this this one. Setup is easy, it all works as advertised. What elese can I say - it's been great, and only should last longer than the now Netgear junk I had before this one.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-J

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router from D-Link but!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: fast and easy setup. dual band SSID is a big plus for me. Cons: USB Shared Port technology only support up to 16 gig drive!!! Make sure you upgrade Shared port utility to version 3.0. the CD will install version 1.0 on your PC. Summary: I'm happy with the wireless part of the router so far however I'm very disappointed that the shared port will only support 16 Gigs!!!
customer_reviews.author: dbnj21

customer_reviews.title: I don't hate it!
customer_reviews.text: The only router that I have never hated. Sadly, this is a hugely significant statement. The default software is surprisingly solid, and it has great DD-WRT and Open-WRT support.
customer_reviews.author: Bluehat

customer_reviews.title: Good Router, excellent for multiple machine networking
customer_reviews.text: We have a fairly complex set of demands on wireless networking in our house including both wired and wireless PCs and wireless notebooks including video streaming, downloads, uploads, etc. No entertainment systems, though, so I can't speak to that. Our experience with this router has been excellent with up to 6 laptops and the PCs sending traffic through it from all over the house. Have tried several N routers in the past, this one was quick and easy to set up, and has worked without a hitch for everyone - even users who can only handle G-band. Works well from wherever in the house, and has been stable for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Greybeard

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this DLink for about a month and it works great. The wireless range is much improved over my Netgear which was my last router. I tried installing the latest version of dd-wrt firmware on the router it worked but the performances was lower then the factory firmware, so I put DLink firmware back on it. This router has like a recover partition on it so basically by trying different firmware it is impossible to brick. Will buy DLink again.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous after reading a lot of the forum on DLINKs website on earlier revisions of this product, but it worked right out of the box for me with only a little challenge getting Shareport up and running. Another trip to the DLINK forum and the question I had was resolved. I now have many PC's sharing the printer connected thru shareport and my network congestion with my old G router is solved. Everyone has enough bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: AZMike

customer_reviews.title: D-Link, D-Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router as a replacement and it has been great. No more rebooting the router so that my laptop can connect. All I have to do is turn on my laptop and I am up and running.
customer_reviews.author: MaryCL

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: It took some work with our kids (IT professionals) to set this up using custom settings. However, our system works better, faster, and more reliably than before, handling our in-house computers and our mobile phones via wi-fi. Better yet, we are invisible to the security testing sites we have used to check on our security level. Our system simply won't acknowledge its existence to anyone not on the approved address lists. Superb security for little cost.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router based on performance and function after years of good experience with an older unit from DLink. Setup and installation seemed easy but getting intermittent streaming issues on the internet. A reset of the router through the network connection works but only for 2 to 3 days. Have the latest firmware and making minor changes to setup to see if anything corrects this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Liscomb

customer_reviews.title: does what it suppose to
customer_reviews.text: as said before in the title its a perfect router, you can do two wireless acess on it which is amazing because you have higher speed
customer_reviews.author: Saviordimes

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Xbox Live
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was having strict NAT problems with my Xbox Live connecting two Xboxes for MW3 using Verizon Fios. This thing worked great. I connected it to my Fios router/modem, I DMZ the D-Link, and now I could connect multiple Xboxes to it with open NAT.
customer_reviews.author: Blakdragun2

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Handles my traffic perfectly. No hiccups. Love the separate frequencies about it
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: As fast as wired on both 2.4 and 5Gig bands - works through out 1700 sq ft house with metal stud walls.
customer_reviews.author: A. McDonley

customer_reviews.title: Not a good router for a big house
customer_reviews.text: Not a good router for a big house, perhaps for a small one and standard internet could work, did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Macedonio Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing service experience
customer_reviews.text: Still working perfectly after six years. Had to contact tech support when I got a new modem, and the representative (AR004205) was superb in handling the integration of the new modem and existing router configurations (C6633897). Completely unexpected and very much appreciated level of service. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Burt Levitch

customer_reviews.title: service all around condo
customer_reviews.text: I live in a two floor condo., this device has range throughout my entire home. Smart phone has excellent signal, laptops, tablets, pc. and my sons ps3.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Poor wireless range
customer_reviews.text: Not as expected. Poor wireless Range. about 20ft (360 degrees). I tried the ASUS N56U router with very notable results.
customer_reviews.author: Korsario

customer_reviews.title: Mac Users Beware
customer_reviews.text: If you are a Mac user you may want to by pass this router. The USB port can not be activated to work with the Mac OS operating system. As a router it seems to work well and has good range, but since I purchased it to share a printer with my laptop I am not happy that D-Link choose not to disclose this in their literature.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Stroven

customer_reviews.title: Wireless network controller
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I needed. The setup was easy, and the performance excellent. I had no problems getting this unit setup and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: D.Wedell

customer_reviews.title: No problems, but lights up the room
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with the router, which I got as a 2nd wireless point in the house. I've had it for several months now. My only problem is I wish manufacturers would quit putting the super bright LED's on everything. I have gadgets all over the house, and at night, the house is lit up like crazy. Stop making the LED's so bright! My review is 4 stars specifically because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Riley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a family member 1 year ago, they have had zero issues to date. I purchased again for myself recently and it works great. Easy set up, great speed and coverage area. The blue lights on the front look cool but are very bright so it doubles as a nightlight for us in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Works but doesn't do everything it promisses
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain about the connection itself although the streaming to my DSM-520 started to have problems with this router. Using an airport express and connecting through wireless n solved the problem but it shows speed of g is much worst than my old d-link router. Really bad part is the shareport USB: with a mac don't even bother trying to make it work. After some investigation I could install the shareport utility but it doesn't work at all: it detects my printer but disconnect after a few seconds. No way to keep it connected with firmware 1.11. I just gave up trying.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo A. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with a new Motorola Surfboard DOCSYS 3.0 Cable Modem and now everything is blazing fast. I am on Comcast and went from wireless [...] speeds of 300k download to 20+M download speed wirelessly. I went from 300 to 400k all the way up to 13M on a wired port (My laptop is way newer and faster than my desktop).
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: D-link technical suport...outstanding
customer_reviews.text: D-Link technical support has been incredible! My DIR-825 was having trouble accessing the internet. Case #C6676809. Mary at D-link technical support (AR004217) first helped me restore internet access and then helped me update the DIR-825 firmware. Never could have figured this out myself. Step by step Mary patiently guided me through the elaborate process.THANK YOU MARY AND THANK YOU D-LINK!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: internetm

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item about a month ago. I have not had the issues that others have had. Works great as advertised. I also bought d-link wireless bridge that goes with this router and set up was easy and fast. The only negative is that the activity lights on the router and bridge are very bright blue. Could be a bit anoying in a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: Rj Spencer

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR 825 Extreme-N Router
customer_reviews.text: This router is everything they say it is. I have only dropped link once and it wasn't the routers fault. I had to call D-Link company and they walked me right through getting it back online and I have never dropped since. Powerful enough to go through my whole house. I don't have to worry anymore about where I want to sit with my laptop it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: tessabme

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service, product great
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested the abilities of the 5 GHZ band yet, but the 2.4 is working flawlessly. Also, had a conflict with my ISP's DSL modem IP address, as it was using the same one as the router. Customer service quickly identified this and helped me change it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my ailing draft n router, and so far I have been very impressed with it's performance. In my home I often stream multiple hd videos over my wireless that are in excess of 15 MB/sec each and this router has had no problems, handling that amount of traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Wish the interface was better
customer_reviews.text: Restarting the router takes forever and the Admin UI is horrible. But it is a reliable and fast router.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR-825 Xtreme N
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a wireless router is not dropping the signal I recommend D-Link DIR-825 Xtreme, has not failed me at any time and has powerful signal, I recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Maikel

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I did not like is that it won't let you assign the LAN and WAN to the same subnet, so you have to build some routing in somewhere if you need packets flowing between subnets.
customer_reviews.author: TL.Bridges

customer_reviews.title: lifesaver....
customer_reviews.text: totally awesome.....we have 3 teens (all with laptops) and my husband and I also have laptops. with 5 laptops and a PS3.... our old wireless router wasnt cuttin it...but now we can all get online and play the PS3 online games all at the same time without gettin DCed... all i can say about the D-Link DIR-825 Xtreme N Dual Band Router is AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Setup took about 5 minutes and was very easy. I have noticed a good speed increase from my previous Linksys router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Great range, I have had no problems with this router at all. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: D-Link
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to setup and install the software. The d-link is easy to use and operate. I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W. Newman

customer_reviews.title: cd not very good, but support staff very good
customer_reviews.text: The CD that came with the router is worthless. After many attempts, I finally decided to call tech-support. The tech got me to do a manual setup. It was easy and fast. Like I said, DON'T USE the CD. Call support line and have them help you.
customer_reviews.author: nomad

customer_reviews.title: My duo n router
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my dlink duo n router, I was sure the signal would be strong enuogh to bend around the corner but it was'nt the case. Inspite of that I'm happy with my new router.
customer_reviews.author: Lore1

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you know exactly what it is that you will be doing with it. I bought this for gaming, this is one of the models that Xbox supports for multiple Xbox's on the same connection. Outstanding and nicely priced..
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Good Product...Misleading Description of 5.0 gigahertz Band
customer_reviews.text: My previous D-link router was a single band DIR-655 and did a fine job. Unfortunately, it was struck by lightning. I decided to upgrade my router to the DIR-825 to take advantage of the dual band 2.4/5.0 gigahertz capability. Supposedly 5.0 gigahertz is good for media streaming devices. Dlink fails to mention that the 5.0 gigahertz range is probably half or worse than the 2.4 gigahertz range. If you don't have media devices in the same room as the router stick with the single band DIR-655.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: no intruder info in router log, ipv6 fair
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to firmware 2.05na (a two-step upgrade). Found the router log contains (almost) no entry about intruder. For those who use to view dir-655 detail intruder information, there may be some disappointment. Log entries are displayed only 10 entries per page. It may take a while to view large amount of entries. For IPV6 part, it offers automatic, IPv6 over PPPoE, Static IPv6 address and Route, Tunneling Connection (6rd) options. I only tried the 6rd one, it works with comcast by the configuration information found on comcast website. Nothing else has been attempted yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: After 3 calls to tech support, it's now working...very well.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Instructions for setting it up are easy to understand but getting it to work is another matter, hence the need to call tech support.
customer_reviews.author: cancel

product_meta.title: D-Link DIR-825 Extreme-N Dual-Band Gigabit Router
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER



The Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router is one of D-Link's most powerful routers and is designed specifically for high quality home entertainment. It uses Wireless N technology, which is much faster and farther reaching than Wireless G, so you can enjoy a strong and reliable Wi-Fi Internet connection throughout your home. Plus, this router is a dual band router, which means it operates on two Wi-Fi frequencies instead of just one, so you can watch all the HD content you want interference-free.








THE DUAL BAND ADVANTAGE
Most routers operate on one band only, the 2.4GHz band. This is the same wireless band that devices like cordless phones and other household appliances use. While it works well for surfing the Internet and checking email, it can get overly congested, making it unsuitable for high-bandwidth applications like streaming video. The Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router operates on both the commonly-used 2.4GHz band and the clearer 5GHz band, which is less-prone to interference from other devices. That means that you can check email and surf the Internet on one while streaming HD movies on the other so neither band gets overloaded! 





KEY FEATURES








INTERNET UNLEASHED
Connect this router to a cable or DSL modem and give high-speed Internet access to multiple computers, game consoles, and media players … without the mess of wires. 

SHARING IS CARING
So your brother has all the family photos on his computer and you're dying to edit the bad ones before he posts them on Facebook? No problem. This router creates a secure Wi-Fi network so your computers can share stuff like photos, music, videos, printers, and more.

XTREME N: LIGHTNING FAST 
The Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router is what is known as an 802.11n (Wireless N) device, which is a fancy way to say it's fast. Really fast. In fact, thanks to Xtreme N Technology, it delivers up to 14x faster speeds and 6x farther range* than 802.11g (Wireless G). Plus, it will still get along just fine with any Wireless G devices you may already have. Ah, convenience. 

MULTITASKING MACHINE
This router is equipped with Dual Band Technology that supports 2.4GHz and 5GHz wireless signals at the same time. In English? You get to check e-mail and browse the Internet using the 2.4GHz band while streaming HD movies and other media on the 5GHz band. Neither band gets overloaded. This helps to avoid interference and lag, making it perfect for HD video streaming, file sharing, enhanced Internet phone calling (VoIP), and Web surfing.

D-LINK GREEN
While this may look like your average router, it's not. This is a D-Link Green router, which is as good for your wallet as it is for the environment. This router … 

 * Automatically powers down ports that have no link
 * Budgets power output for different Ethernet cable lengths
 * Includes wireless LAN scheduling, which can shut down your wireless network when not in use for further power savings
 * Reduces energy consumption by using an Energy Star qualified power adapter
 * Complies with the European Union's RoHS directive that restricts the use of certain hazardous materials
 * Uses recyclable packaging to help reduce waste that goes into the environment

THE POWER OF GIGABIT
In addition to offering you blazing fast Wi-Fi speeds, the Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router also includes four 10/100/1000 Gigabit ports so you can connect wired devices to your network. That's right, you can enjoy fast and reliable Wi-Fi and still use wired connections for lag-free network gaming and faster file transfers.

PRIORITIES, PLEASE
With D-Link's award-winning Intelligent QoS Technology, wired and wireless traffic is analyzed and separated so priority can be given to applications with sensitivity to delay. That means your VoIP, HD video, and online gaming can stream smoothly to your TV or PC. Goodbye, lag.

NO VIRUSES ALLOWED
Worried about the security of your wireless network? Don't be. This router supports the latest security features (WPA, WPA2, SPI, and NAT) to help prevent unauthorized access from over your wireless network or from the Internet.

EASY DOES IT
Thanks to D-Link's Quick Router Setup wizard, getting your router up and running couldn't be easier. It walks you though every step of the installation process so you can get networking in no time. 






GET THE MOST OUT OF YOUR ROUTER
Use the Xtreme N Dual Band USB Adapter (DWA-160) to add powerful dual band 11n Wi-Fi technology to your desktop or notebook computer. Simply plug the DWA-160 into an available USB port and connect to a wireless network to access a high-speed Internet connection. Enjoy greater wireless reception for transferring files, online gaming, and streaming media from greater distances around your home. 









PRODUCT SPECS
 * Standards: IEEE 802.11n, IEEE 802.11g, IEEE 802.11a, IEEE 802.3, IEEE 802.3u
 * Interface Type: 4 Gigabit LAN Ports, 1 Gigabit WAN Port, 1 USB Port (for SharePort & Windows Connect Now)
 * Antenna Type: 2 External Reverse SMA Dualband Antennas
 * Security: WPA & WPA2 (Wi-Fi Protected Access), Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) - PIN & PBC
 * Advanced Firewall Features: Network Address Translation (NAT), Stateful Packet Inspection (SPI), VPN Pass-through / Multi-sessions PPTP / L2TP / IPSec
 * Device Management: Internet Explorer v6 or Later; Mozilla Firefox v1.5 or Later; or other Java-enabled Browsers
 * Certifications: FCC Class B, IC, IPv6 Gold, Wi-Fi
 * Dimensions: Item (WxDxH): 4.6" x 7.6" x 1.2", Packaging (WxDxH): 9.6" x 11.1" x 3.1"
 * Weight: Item: 0.7 lbs, Packaging: 2.0 lbs
 * Warranty: 1 Year Limited*
 * Recommended System Requirements: For optimal wireless performance, use with the D-Link Xtreme N Dual Band USB Adapter (DWA-160)
 * Minimum System Requirements: Computer with Windows Vista**, Windows XP SP2** or Mac OS X (v10.4)***; Internet Explorer v6 or Mozilla Firefox v1.5; CD-ROM Drive; Network Interface Card; and for Internet access a Cable or DSL Modem and Subscription with an Internet Service Provider (ISP)






WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * Xtreme N Dual Band Gigabit Router
 * 2 Detachable Antennas
 * CAT5 Ethernet Cable
 * Power Adapter
 * CD-ROM**** with Installation Wizard and Product Documentation



* 1-Year Limited Warranty available only in the U.S.A and Canada.
** Computer must adhere to Microsoft's recommended System Requirements.
*** The software included with this product is not Mac-compatible.
**** Latest software and documentation are available online at www.dlink.com.
feature_bullets: Intelligent QoS technology prioritizes Internet traffic as well as wired and wireless network traffic
Xtreme N technology allows for farther home coverage
Secure your wireless network using advanced WPA or WPA2 encryption
Supports Good Neighbor Policy--will not interfere with other wireless networks
Backward compatible with 802.11g and 802.11a devices including game consoles and digital media players

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars456 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
